feed.title: The Web Dev Diaries - My Journey as a Web Developer.
feed.subtitle: Welcome to my site, where I share my diaries as a web developer. Here you will find stories, insights, and tips from my personal and professional journey as a web developer. Whether you are a beginner, an experienced developer, or just curious about web development, you will find something interesting and useful here. I write about various topics related to web development, such as coding, design, tools, trends, challenges, and achievements. I also share my opinions, thoughts, and feelings about web development and how it affects my life. My goal is to inspire, inform, and entertain you with my diaries as a web developer. I hope you enjoy reading them as much as I enjoy writing them. Thank you for visiting my site! ðŸ˜Š

entry.title: Create my blog over Github
entry.content:
General guide for creating a GitHub Blog site:

  • Set Up/Sign in a GitHub Account(philipwhole)
  • Install Ruby and Jekyll
  • Create a New GitHub Repository(philipwhole.github.io)
  • Clone the Repository to local then, cd philipwhole.github.io
  • Initialize Jekyll( jekyll new .)
  • Customize the _config.yml file: blog title, description, author information etc.
  • Create Blog Posts: yyyy-mm-dd-title.md
  • Test Locally: bundle exec jekyll serve
  • Commit and Push Changes
  • Set Up GitHub Pages
  • Access the Blog: philipwhole.github.io

Tip: Write the blog content using Markdown syntax.

Good luck in building your own GitHub blog site!
entry.summary: General guide for creating a GitHub Blog site:
